com.appboy.models

Interface IInAppMessageHtml

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IInAppMessage
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IInAppMessageHtmlBase, InAppMessageHtmlFull

    public interface IInAppMessageHtml
extends IInAppMessage
    IInAppMessageHtmlBase is the base model interface for all Html In-App Messages. HTML In-App Messages are defined as In-App Messages that take up the entire screen and/or 'block' the user from interacting with the app until the message is dismissed. The expected format is an html string accompanied with a zip file remote url containing all the assets such as images, fonts, etc. The html string is encoded into the message field of the In-App message. Known implementing classes include IInAppMessageHtmlBase InAppMessageHtmlFull

        Sets the remote URL of the assets zip file.

      • setLocalAssetsDirectoryUrl

        void setLocalAssetsDirectoryUrl(java.lang.String assetsLocalDirectoryUrl)
        Sets the local URL of the assets directory for the html In-App Message.
        Parameters:
        assetsLocalDirectoryUrl - Local file URL for the unpacked assets directory.

      • getAssetsZipRemoteUrl

        java.lang.String getAssetsZipRemoteUrl()
        Gets the remote URL of the assets zip file of this In-App Message.
        Returns:
        zip file assets URL

      • getLocalAssetsDirectoryUrl

        java.lang.String getLocalAssetsDirectoryUrl()
        Gets the local URL of the assets. This location corresponds to the unzipped file system directory of the remote assets file given by getAssetsZipRemoteUrl().
        Returns:
        Local file URL for the unpacked assets directory.

      • logButtonClick

        boolean logButtonClick(java.lang.String buttonId)
        Logs a click on a button in your html in-app message. Button clicks may only be logged once per in-app message.
        Parameters:
        buttonId - the id of the button
        Returns:
        true if the click was successfully logged.
